intro: Allioniella oxybaphoides var. glabrata, commonly known as the smoothleaf allioniella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite leaves that are typically smooth and glabrous. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually arranged in whorls along the stems, often displaying vibrant colors such as red or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical or subtropical regions.
